newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: MCB supports Mauritius share index in mixed market.
newsitem.headline: MCB supports Mauritius share index in mixed market.

text.p: A rise in Mauritius Commercial Bank, Rogers and Sun Resorts provided support to the Mauritius bourse index, Semdex, in a trading session in which moving stocks ended mixed, brokers said on Monday.
The Semdex gained 0.30 points to 372.19 on transaction volume of 20.15 million rupees on 485,820 shares from 7.37 million rupees on 328,621 shares last Friday.
The MCB climbed 50 cents to 85.50 rupees on 69,282 shares, while British American Insurance (BAI) gained 5 cents to 8.55 rupees on 5,500 shares.

In the commerce sector, conglomerate Rogers climbed by a rupee to 101 rupees on 48,091 shares, Courts fell by 20 cents to 3.80 on 8,285 shares, Ireland Blyth Limited (IBL) was unchanged at 14.50 rupees on 1,500 shares and Happy World Foods (HWF) was stable at 15.00 rupees on 2,187 shares.

In the investment sector, Promotion And Investment (PAD) was stable at 15 rupees on 201,000 shares, Fincorp lost 1.50 rupees to 70 rupees on 2,850 shares and Policy remained at 4.50 rupees on 6,000 shares.

Hotel concern Grand Baie Hotels (GBH) was unchanged at 46.20 rupees on 100,200 shares, New Mauritius Hotels (NMH) was stable at 36.00 rupees on 20,000 shares and Sun Resorts gained 40 cents to 45.10 rupees on 5,426 shares.
National carrier Air Mauritius fell by 1 rupee to 40 rupees on 4,000 shares.
